meanings.definition: A joint or connection between bones in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the artic in my knee to see if there was any damage.
meanings.sent2: Her artic was sore after playing basketball for hours.
meanings.sent3: The artic in his shoulder decided to take a break and relax.
meanings.sent4: The artic in the bridge allowed the structure to bend gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The artic in the robot's arm moved smoothly and efficiently.

meanings.definition: To express or communicate something clearly.
meanings.sent1: She articulates her thoughts well during presentations.
meanings.sent2: Please artic your ideas so everyone can understand.
meanings.sent3: He articulates his love for pizza in a very passionate way.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes articulated her sadness without saying a word.
meanings.sent5: The artist articulates emotions through their paintings beautifully.

meanings.definition: A segment of a structure, such as a vehicle or machine, that allows for movement or flexibility.
meanings.sent1: The artic of the crane allowed it to reach high places easily.
meanings.sent2: The robotic arm's artic was crucial for its precise movements.
meanings.sent3: The artic of the car decided to go on strike and refused to move.
meanings.sent4: The artic of the roller coaster made the ride thrilling and fun.
meanings.sent5: The artic of the puppet made it dance and entertain the children.
